item.title: Fundamental Analysis 101: A basic overview of the fundamental analysis of stocks
item.description: In this post, I would like to give an overview of the principles and concepts in the fundamental analysis of stocks. What is fundamental analysis? Well, fundamental analysis (FA) is the analysis of the fundamentals of a company. The fundamentals of the company are trying to capture essentially the health of the company, in the present and future. The objective of FA is to discern a point of view on the current and future prospects of a company – the actionability from this point of view is of course whether to buy (or short-sell) the stock.

item.title: Book Review: Rich by Retirement by Joshua Giersch
item.description: Joshua Giersch, better known as “Shiny Things”, is an investment guru who has been generously giving investing advice on HardwareZone and his blog. His advice are consistently dished out with the SG context in mind, and his book “Rich by Retirement: How Singaporeans Can Invest Smart and Retire Wealthy”, is, in essence, the consolidation of all of his tips and hacks on being a successful investor in SG.
